dev.jeka.core.api.kotlin

Class JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.jeka.core.api.kotlin.JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec

  • public final class JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec
extends java.lang.Object
    Stands for a compilation settings as source and target version, encoding, annotation processing or any option supported by the compileRunner.

      • getTargetVersion

        public JkJavaVersion getTargetVersion()

      • setTargetVersion

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setTargetVersion(JkJavaVersion version)
        Sets the target Java version for compiled classes. Normally it is the same as the platform compileRunner shipped with but you can set it explicitly. Also, when set explicitly JkJavaCompiler can choose to use the appropriate compileRunner to compile to the specified target.

      • getEncoding

        public java.lang.String getEncoding()

      • setEncoding

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Creates a copy of this JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec but using the specified source encoding (e.g. UTF-8). If null is specified, then default plateform encoding will be used.

      • addSources

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec addSources(java.lang.Iterable<java.nio.file.Path> paths)
        Adds specified source files to the set of java sources to compile.

        public java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getSourceFiles()
        Returns all source files to be compiled.

      • setClasspath

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setClasspath(java.lang.Iterable<java.nio.file.Path> files)
        Creates a copy of this JkJavaCompiler but with the specified classpath.

      • addOptions

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec addOptions(java.lang.String... options)
        Adds specified options to pass to the compileRunner. Options are option you pass in javac command line as -deprecation, -nowarn, ... For example, if you want something equivalent to javac -deprecation -cp path1 path2, you should pass "-deprecation", "-cp", "path1", "path2" parameters.

      • addOptions

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec addOptions(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> options)
        See addOptions(String...)

      • setOption

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setOption(java.lang.String optionName,
                                        java.lang.String optionValue)
        Some options of a compileRunner are set in a couple of name/value (version, classpath, .....). So if you want to explicitly set such an option it is desirable to remove current value instead of adding it at the queue of options. This method does this for you.

      • setAnnotationProcessors

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setAnnotationProcessors(java.lang.String... annotationProcessorClassNames)
        Sets specified annotation classes instead of using the ones discovered by default Java 6 mechanism.

      • disableAnnotationProcessing

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec disableAnnotationProcessing()
        Disable annotation processing.

      • setAnnotationProcessingOnly

        public JkKotlinJvmCompileSpec setAnnotationProcessingOnly()
        Only process annotation.

        public java.lang.String getNextValue(java.lang.String optionName)
